posts.title: Love Me Deadly
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:A grim tale of a lovely girl who likes to have sex with dead men (…erm…does rigor-mortis set in down there?). Through frequent visits to the local mortuary, she networks into a group of like-minded individuals. Unfortunately, her husband is unaware of her perversion and wonders why he’s not “getting any”.

posts.title: Pascali’s Island
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:‘Set in 1908 during decline of the Ottoman Empire. A dissatisfied spy for the Sultan, Pascali, offers his services as translator to a visiting archaeologist from Britain. Matters are complicated by the fact that the archaelogist falls in love with Pascali’s friend Lydia.’– BFI

posts._title: Edgar Reitz – Der Schneider von Ulm AKA The Tailor From Ulm (1978)
posts.title: Der Schneider von Ulm
posts.excerpt: “The Tailor from Ulm was the last of Edgar Reitz’ pre-Heimat features and a far cry from Lust for Love in terms of style and setting. posts._title: Boris Barnet – Ledolom aka The Thaw (1931)
posts.title: Ledolom
posts.excerpt: Quote:The son of a kulak has an affair with a poor girl and an eye within the village council so that his father’s interest could be preserved. But a man reveals how the kulak intend to impoverish more the peasants and workers and get freed from taxes.

posts._title: Lasse Braun – Victory for the Queen (1971)
posts.title: Victory for the Queen
posts.excerpt: Freyja is the Queen and leader of a group of Vikings who voyage along the coast of Normandy, plundering and ravaging the countryside. Ashore they discover two beautiful nuns who in the belief that they are alone kiss and caress each other. Freyja leads the attack and lets her warriors satisfy their desires with the …

posts._title: Levan Akin – And Then We Danced (2019)
posts.title: And Then We Danced
posts.excerpt: Merab has been training since a young age at the National Georgian Ensemble with his dance partner Mary. His world is suddenly turned upside down when the charismatic and carefree Irakli arrives and becomes both his strongest rival and desire. In this conservative setting Merab finds himself having to break free and risk it all.

posts._title: Arunas Zebriunas – Polunochnyk AKA Naktibalada AKA Nightbird (1973)
posts.title: Polunochnyk
posts.excerpt: In his dreams little Tomas escapes from his every day live to experience a lot of thrilling and exciting adventures.

posts.title: Joe Kidd
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:Joe Kidd (Clint Eastwood) is a former bounty hunter and all-around tough-guy in the American southwest. When a band of Mexicans find their U.S. land claims denied and all relevant records destroyed in a courthouse fire, they turn to force-of-arms. Luis Chama (John Saxon) is their charismatic leader, spouting revolutionary rhetoric and demanding land reform. …
